Module lanat
Package lanat

Class ArgumentParser

java.lang.Object
lanat.utils.ErrorsContainerImpl<Error.CustomError>
lanat.Command
lanat.ArgumentParser
All Implemented Interfaces:
ArgumentAdder, ArgumentGroupAdder, CommandAdder, CommandUser, MultipleNamesAndDescription, NamedWithDescription, ParentElementGetter<Command>, ErrorCallbacks<ParseResult,Command>, ErrorsContainer<Error.CustomError>, Resettable
public class ArgumentParser extends Command

Argument Parser

Provides the ability to parse a command line input and later gather the values of the parsed arguments.

See Also:
  • Command

    • ArgumentParser

      public ArgumentParser(@NotNull @NotNull Class<? extends CommandTemplate> templateClass)
      Creates a new command based on the given CommandTemplate. This does not take Sub-Commands into account. If you want to add Sub-Commands, use from(Class) instead.
      Parameters:
      templateClass - The class of the template to use.
      See Also:
      • CommandTemplate

  • Method Details

    • from

      public static ArgumentParser from(@NotNull @NotNull Class<? extends CommandTemplate> templateClass)
      Constructs a new ArgumentParser based on the given CommandTemplate, taking Sub-Commands into account.

      This is basically a shortcut for the following code: 

      
 new ArgumentParser(clazz) {{
     this.addCommand(new Command(subCmdClazz)); // do this for all possible sub-commands
 }};
      This method basically makes it easier to add Sub-Commands to the given CommandTemplate. It looks for CommandTemplate.CommandAccessor annotations in the given class and adds the corresponding sub-commands to the Command object. This is done recursively.
      Parameters:
      templateClass - The class of the CommandTemplate to use.
      Returns:
      A new ArgumentParser based on the given CommandTemplate.
      See Also:
      • CommandTemplate

    • parseFromInto

      @NotNull public static <T extends CommandTemplate> T parseFromInto(@NotNull @NotNull Class<T> templateClass, @NotNull @NotNull CLInput input, @NotNull @NotNull Consumer<@NotNull ArgumentParser.AfterParseOptions> options)
      Constructs a new ArgumentParser based on the given CommandTemplate, parses the given input, and populates the template with the parsed values.

      This is basically a shortcut for the following code: 

      
 ArgumentParser.from(clazz).parse(input).into(clazz);

      Example:

      This code: 
      
 ArgumentParser.from(MyTemplate.class)
     .parse(input)
     .printErrors()
     .exitIfErrors()
     .into(MyTemplate.class);

      Is equivalent to this code: 

      
 MyTemplate parsed = ArgumentParser.parseFromInto(MyTemplate.class, input);
      The example above uses the parseFromInto(Class, CLInput) overload, which sets the default options for the ArgumentParser.AfterParseOptions object.

      This method uses from(Class). See that method for more info.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the template.
      Parameters:
      templateClass - The class to use as a template.
      input - The input to parse.
      options - A consumer that can be used for configuring the parsing process.
      Returns:
      The parsed template.
      See Also:
      • parseFromInto(Class, CLInput)
      • CommandTemplate
      • from(Class)
      • ArgumentParser.AfterParseOptions

    • parseFromInto

      @NotNull public static <T extends CommandTemplate> T parseFromInto(@NotNull @NotNull Class<T> templateClass, @NotNull @NotNull CLInput input)

      Type Parameters:
